item.title: Strictly Come Dancing: Tom Fletcher, AJ Odudu and Robert Webb in line-up
item.description: McFly's Tom Fletcher, TV presenter AJ Odudu and Peep Show's Robert Webb will take to the dancefloor.

item.title: Nearly a third of waking hours spent on TV and streaming, Ofcom says
item.description: Older people watched more linear TV while on-demand is big hit with younger audience.

item.title: Jack Antonoff has redefined pop music. Here's how
item.description: Taylor Swift, Lana Del Rey and Lorde all rely on his advice. Now he's making a statement of his own.

item.title: Love Island: 'Misleading' Casa Amor episode sparks 4,330 complaints
item.description: More than 4,000 viewers complained that events were misleading and caused unnecessary distress.

item.title: Barbra Streisand: 'I've always had the right to sing what I want'
item.description: The star looks back at her career, and explains how she's always maintained creative control.

item.title: Rihanna now officially a billionaire
item.description: The star is now the wealthiest female musician in the world, according to Forbes.

item.title: Selena Gomez criticises 'tasteless' TV transplant joke
item.description: The Good Fight is the latest show to reference singer Selena Gomez's 2017 kidney transplant.

item.title: The Offspring drummer Pete Parada says he was dropped over vaccine refusal
item.description: Pete Parada says a doctor advised him not to have the jab because of a rare autoimmune disorder.

item.title: Top Gear production to move to Bristol from 2022
item.description: The long-running BBC motoring show will move out of London next year.

item.title: Matt Damon says he has never personally used gay slur
item.description: The Hollywood star had been criticised for saying he had only recently "retired" the insult.

item.title: Wagatha Christie: Jamie Vardy's phone may be analysed in libel case
item.description: The device could now be inspected as part of Rebekah Vardy's and Coleen Rooney's libel battle.

item.title: Lauren Goodger foreign exchange Instagram advert banned
item.description: The TV star had been paid for a post that a watchdog says wasn't obviously identifiable as an ad.

item.title: Olly Murs has knee surgery after Newmarket racecourse injury
item.description: The singer hurts himself jumping into the air at an open air gig at a racecourse.

item.title: TRNSMT festival confirmed to go ahead in September
item.description: Organiser Geoff Ellis said the event had permission to go ahead with 50,000 music fans attending.

item.title: Bennifer 2.0: How Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck got us talking again
item.description: How a viral photo of Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck exposed the internet's lust for nostalgia.

item.title: Annabel Williams: Behind the scenes secrets of a celebrity vocal coach
item.description: She has voice-trained Amy Winehouse, Jennifer Hudson and reckons she can help anyone to sing.

item.title: EastEnders: 'I was ignorant about my schizophrenia'
item.description: Antonio Ferreira is using his personal experience to advise the soap on a storyline.

item.title: The X Factor: What became of the star-making hit show?
item.description: How the show that once topped viewing figures, and created big stars appears to have run its course.

item.title: The Strokes' Is This It at 20: Nudes, booze and 9/11
item.description: How the New York City band's 2001 debut album heralded "a new spirit in guitar music".

item.title: H.E.R. on shedding her anonymity and conquering R&B
item.description: For years the singer stayed in the shadows but after Grammy and Oscar wins she's ready to be seen.

item.title: Becoming Tina Turner in London's West End
item.description: Aisha Jawando takes over from Adrienne Warren in the title role in the musical Tina.

item.title: Fisherwomen honoured in photography exhibition
item.description: An exhibition is dedicated to decades of women who have worked in the industry on the east coast.

item.title: Four-year-old US piano prodigy flourishing amid pandemic
item.description: Brigitte's parents just wanted to keep her busy. Now, she's been invited to play at Carnegie Hall.

item.title: I'm A Celebrity 2021: Ant & Dec to return to Gwrych Castle
item.description: Ant and Dec are returning to Wales to host I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here! from Gwrych Castle.

item.title: Billie Eilish opens up to Clara Amfo on internet trolls
item.description: Eilish tells Amfo of her frustration with internet criticism in a new documentary.

item.title: KT Tunstall on her show-halting hearing loss
item.description: The singer-songwriter has put her touring plans on hold over concerns she could become completely deaf.
